SEARCH
Package allSystems

Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
allSystems.Scheduler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Scheduler extends Object implements Runnable
Represents a Scheduler entity and will run as a thread The scheduler receives messages from Floor and Elevators via the Mailbox, and gives commands to the Elevators to tell them which floors to service, when to move, when to stop, when to open/close doors, etc.

      public ArrayList<String> canScheduleRequest(int pickUp, int dropOff)
      checks and returns if elevators will have the capacity to take on a request given pick up and drop off
      Parameters:
      pickUp - start floor of request
      dropOff - finish floor of request
      Returns:
      a list of elevators that will be able to handle the requests

    • getOptimalElevator

      public String getOptimalElevator(int pickUp, int dropOff)
      A function that filters through all elevators and find the elevator that will complete the request best, based on pre-determined rules.
      Parameters:
      pickUp - pick up floor
      dropOff - drop off floor
      Returns:
      returns elevator that is best suited to handle the request

    • updateElevatorJob

      public HashMap<Message.MessageStatus,ArrayList<Message>> updateElevatorJob(String elevator, int floor, int queueNumber)
      Updates the jobs that have a boarding passenger on the floor specified, or has a passenger getting off.
      Parameters:
      elevator - elevator in which the request is contained
      floor - floor number the elevator is on
      queueNumber - the queue number on which the elevator is working on
      Returns:
      returns a list of all jobs that have been updated

    • getFloorMessages

      public ArrayList<Message> getFloorMessages(String elevator, int floor, int queueNumber)
      Parameters:
      elevator - elevator name
      floor - floor number
      queueNumber - queue in which the request is stored in
      Returns:
      returns all requests that are to be updated on the specified floor and queue number

    • getNextJob

      public Message getNextJob(ArrayList<Message> jobs)
      returns the next job to send as a TRAVEL_TO_FLOOR message to the elevator from a list of that elevator's jobs that will fulfil the next stop
      Parameters:
      jobs - : the list of messages selected from jobs assigned to that elevator that are related to its next stop
      Returns:
      : a single message to send as its next job
